etymologies: Oriya and Punjabi khaṇḍā, from Prakrit, of uncertain origin

definitions: an emblem of Sikhism, representing a vertical two-edged sword with its blade surrounded by a circle and its hilt intersected by the crossing hilts of two single-edged swords.
shortDefinitions: emblem of Sikhism, representing vertical two-edged sword with its blade surrounded by circle
